data.title: Mastercard Stock Rises as MetaMask Launches its MA Debit Card as Crypto Spending Hits Mainstreet USA
data.description:
The wall between your crypto wallet and your morning coffee has finally crumbled. Mastercard (MA) and MetaMask announced the official U.S. launch of their joint crypto debit card. This rollout is a massive win for the industry because it includes New York, a state known for having the toughest crypto rules in the country. Now, almost any American can use their digital assets to pay for groceries, gas, or even a Netflix subscription. The news sent Mastercard's stock up by 1.2% in early trading on Thursday.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Mastercard Integration Provides Global Reach

The secret to this card's success is the massive network provided by Mastercard. Instead of trying to build a new payment system from scratch, MetaMask is plugging directly into Mastercard's existing ecosystem. This means you can use the card at over 150 million stores and websites worldwide.

Partnering with a giant like Mastercard gives crypto the stamp of approval it needs for everyday use. When you tap your phone to pay, the Mastercard network handles the heavy lifting, turning your crypto into dollars in the blink of an eye. This integration allows users to keep their money in the digital world while still being able to spend it in the physical one.

Self-Custody Tech Keeps You in Control

Unlike traditional crypto cards, which act like a bank account where the company holds your money, the MetaMask Card is different. It uses self-custody technology, which means the tokens stay in your private wallet until the exact second you make a purchase. You are the only person with the keys to your funds.

Retaining full control of your assets is a huge selling point for people who don't trust big exchanges. Most other cards require you to pre-load money onto an exchange, which can be slow and risky. With this new setup, the money only leaves your wallet when you say so. This creates a much safer and faster experience for everyone involved.

Stablecoin Support Reduces Market Risk

To make spending more predictable, the card focuses on stablecoins like USDC and USDT. Because these tokens are pegged to the U.S. dollar, you don't have to worry about the price of your coffee money crashing while you are standing in line. The card also supports Ethereum (ETH-USD) for those who want to spend their gains directly.

Focusing on stablecoins is a smart move for mainstream adoption. It makes crypto feel more like a regular checking account and less like a gamble. As more people move their paychecks into stablecoins to earn higher interest, having a Mastercard that can spend those funds instantly makes the bankless lifestyle a very real option for millions of Americans.

Is Mastercard Still a Good Stock?

On TipRanks, Nvidia stock commands a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 25 Buy and three Hold ratings. The average 12-month MA price target of $660 implies 28.3% upside potential from current levels. Over the past year, MA shares have fallen 9.24%.
data.author: Annika Masrani

data.title: Fed's Miran Urges Four Rate Cuts in 2026 with 'Broadly Stable' Inflation
data.description:
Fed Governor Stephen Miran reiterated his call for the Fed to cut interest rates by 100 bps this year, citing the disinflationary effects of AI amid "broadly stable" prices. Miran added that risks to the labor market are still present, paving the way for lower rates to support employment.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

"One difference between me and some of my colleagues is that I don't think we have an inflation problem," he told Fox Business on Thursday.

Portfolio Fees Add Pressure to Core PCE Inflation, Says Miran

Higher stock market prices have contributed to elevated portfolio management fees. These fees have added 0.4% to the core Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) Index, which last came in at 3%, said Miran. Core PCE is the Fed's preferred inflation gauge and tracks changes in consumer spending while excluding volatile food and energy prices.

The Fed will hold its next Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting on March 18, though a rate cut appears unlikely, with the odds at just 2% according to the CME FedWatch tool.
data.author: Eddie Pan

data.title: Avalon GloboCare Stock (ALBT) Rockets on Acceptance Into AMD's AI Developer Program
data.description:
Avalon GloboCare (ALBT) stock rocketed higher on Thursday after the medical-related consulting services company announced that one of its subsidiaries has been accepted into the Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) AI Developer Program. With this, the company will gain access to AMD Developer Cloud credits, advanced tools, training, and community resources that will aid it in its AI development.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Avalon Quantum AI LLC is the Avalon GloboCare subsidiary that will most benefit from today's news. Avalon Quantum AI LLC intends to focus on the development of its automated commentary video generation systems. It also has plans for future enterprise documentation tools and an AI-powered workflow automation platform.

Meng Li, Avalon GloboCare's interim CEO and Chief Operating Officer, said, "Acceptance into the AMD AI Developer Program reinforces AQAI's technical capabilities as we expand our AI-driven media and automation platforms. Avalon has been strategically repositioning itself as a technology-focused AI company, with AQAI serving as a core growth driver in automated media production and enterprise AI applications."

Avalon GloboCare Stock Movement Today

Avalon GloboCare stock was up 140.06% on Thursday, extending a 2.08% year-to-date rally. However, the stock has fallen 93.13% over the past 12 months.

With today's news came heavy trading of ALBT stock, as some 19 million shares changed hands. For comparison, the company's three-month daily average trading volume is about 32,000 shares.
data.author: William White

data.title: Tesla Stock (TSLA) Slides as Robotaxi Progress Comes Under Scrutiny
data.description:
American electric vehicle maker Tesla's (TSLA) shares fell early Thursday following reports that highlighted shortcomings in its ambition to roll out robotaxis.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

One of the reports suggested that Tesla made no effort in 2025 to secure regulatory go-ahead to launch in California, the U.S.'s biggest auto market. The other report reaffirmed earlier reports that although Tesla's robotaxi rides are cheaper than Alphabet's (GOOGL) Waymo, they come with longer waiting times and largely have human drivers.

No Robotaxi Test Driving in California?

According to Reuters, records from California's Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) showed that Tesla logged no miles of autonomous test driving in the state in 2025. Tesla already has an entry-level permit from the state authority, but requires additional permits to operate fully driverless in the state.

On the other hand, Jefferies (JEF) analysts took several rides in Tesla and Waymo's ride-hailing robotaxi services and found that booking a Tesla failed more than 25% of the time. This is even though Tesla rides turned out to be cheaper due to higher discounts provided.

Tesla Eyes Robotaxi Rollout

Tesla started to test its robotaxi service in Austin in June last year, rolling out with human safety operators, and later in December kicked off unsupervised and driverless rides in the state. The company later launched a human-supervised service in the San Francisco Bay Area of California in late July and plans to expand to other U.S. states this year.

Tesla has drummed up its robotaxi rollout growth strategy, recently moving to a monthly subscription model for its Full Self-Driving (FSD) software. This comes as the automaker's vehicle sales fell for the second consecutive year in 2025.

Earlier this week, Tesla sued California auto authorities over an earlier ruling that concluded that it falsely promoted its vehicles as self-driving. The California DMV had contended that Tesla in 2022 marketed its Autopilot and FSD systems to suggest they were autonomously operated when they required a safety driver.

Is Tesla a Buy or Hold?

On Wall Street, Tesla's shares remain a Hold based on analysts' consensus rating. This breaks down to 12 Buys, 11 Holds, and seven Sells assigned by 30 analysts over the past three months.

Moreover, the average TSLA price target of $396.80 implies about 5% downside risk from current trading levels.
data.author: Solomon Oladipupo

data.title: Dow Jones Climbs on Optimistic Jobless Claims Data
data.description:
The Dow Jones (DJIA) is set to open Thursday higher following the release of new jobs data from the Department of Labor.

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

For the week ended February 21, initial jobless claims rose by 4,000 to 212,000, below the consensus estimate of 216,000. Continuing jobless claims, which trail initial claims by a week, fell by 31,000 to 1.833 million and were below the expectation of 1.858 million.

*This is a developing story. Stay tuned for additional updates.*
data.author: Eddie Pan

data.title: The Trade Desk Stock (TTD) Tanks after Q4 Earnings, Analysts Cut Price Targets
data.description:
Shares of The Trade Desk, Inc. (TTD) tanked more than 14% in pre-market trading today after the adtech firm issued a softer-than-expected first-quarter outlook. Adding to concerns, several top analysts lowered their price targets on TTD stock, citing weak industry trends, margin pressure, and competitive headwinds.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

For context, The Trade Desk specializes in programmatic digital advertising and data-driven marketing solutions.

TTD's Results Snapshot

The Trade Desk reported Q4 revenue of $847 million, up 14% year over year and above the Wall Street estimate of $841 million. Adjusted EPS came in at $0.59, beating the $0.58 consensus. For the full year, TTD posted $2.9 billion in revenue, up 18% from 2024.

While profitability remained solid, net income margins slipped, falling to 22% in Q4 from 25% a year earlier and declining to 15% for the full year from 16%.

Wells Fargo Lowers TTD Target on Market Concerns

Following the results, analyst Alec Brondolo at Wells Fargo lowered the price target on TTD stock to $25 from $42, maintaining a Hold rating. He noted that Q4 results came in line with expectations, but Q1 revenue and EBITDA guidance came in 2% and 12% below estimates, respectively.

While management cited macro weakness in the Auto and CPG sectors, Brondolo noted that ongoing competitive pressures and take-rate concerns likely leave investor worries unresolved.

BofA Cuts TTD Target on Weak Margins

BofA five-star analyst Jessica Reif Ehrlich cut the price target on TTD stock from $40 to $20 while maintaining a Sell rating. She noted that guidance for the upcoming quarter points to slower revenue growth and significantly weaker margins, driven by softer demand in key advertising categories and higher planned investments.

Ehrlich also highlighted rising competition from well-funded rivals, which pressures pricing and makes near-term performance less predictable. While long-term growth drivers remain, she believes reduced earnings estimates, a lower margin profile, and a growth trajectory more in line with adtech peers no longer justify the stock's historical premium.

Is Trade Desk a Good Stock to Buy?

The Trade Desk's stock has a consensus Moderate Buy rating among 28 Wall Street analysts. That rating is based on 13 Buys, 13 Holds, and two Sells issued in the last three months. The average TTD price target of $38.17 implies a 51.7% upside from current levels.
data.author: Kirti Tak

data.title: Archer Aviation Earnings Ahead: Could Q4 Results Spark a Big Move in ACHR Stock?
data.description:
Archer Aviation (ACHR) could see a sharp stock reaction when it reports fourth-quarter results on Monday, March 2, as options traders are pricing in elevated volatility. Based on options pricing, ACHR stock is expected to move about 15.07% in either direction after the release, higher than its average post-earnings move (in absolute terms) of 12.5% over the past four quarters.

data.title: U.S. Stock Futures Inch Higher as Investors Assess Nvidia's Q4 Earnings
data.description:
U.S. stock futures edged higher on Thursday morning as traders assessed chip giant Nvidia's (NVDA) Q4 FY26 results. Futures on the Nasdaq 100 (NDX), the S&P 500 (SPX), and the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) were up 0.03%, 0.08%, and 0.22%, respectively, at 8:30 a.m. EST on February 26.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

During Wednesday's regular trading, the three major indexes closed higher as tech and software stocks rebounded from an AI-driven selloff. Oracle (ORCL) rose 1.2%, and all members of the "Magnificent Seven" closed in the green. The DJIA gained 0.63%, while the Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 were up 1.26% and 0.81%, respectively.

After markets closed, Nvidia posted solid Q4 FY26 results, beating on both sales and earnings expectations. Nonetheless, its shares barely moved, reflecting cautious market sentiment given the company's outsized sway over tech stocks and major indexes like the Nasdaq.

Turning to trending stocks, Trade Desk (TTD) stock tanked more than 15% in Thursday's pre-market trading after the ad-tech company's Q1 revenue and adjusted EBITDA outlook lagged expectations. C3.ai (AI) stock plunged 24% after the company's fiscal third-quarter results missed the Street's projections.

Meanwhile, IonQ (IONQ) stock rallied more than 14% after the quantum computing company issued a strong revenue outlook for the first quarter and full year. Also, Nutanix (NTNX) stock jumped 19% after the cloud software company announced a multi-year partnership with Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) to develop an AI infrastructure platform.  

On the earnings front, notable companies reporting today include CoreWeave (CRWV), Block (XYZ), and SoundHound AI (SOUN).
data.author: Sirisha Bhogaraju
